sentences.english: And the nutrition will also be lost if we use the iron or copper pan to cook the mushrooms.
sentences.chinese: 煮蘑菇时也不能用铁锅或铜锅，以免造成营养损失。

sentences.english: Fry the dried sweet potato leaves into iron boiler and pay attention to do not fry to burn.
sentences.chinese: 将干燥后的红薯叶放入铁锅中炒，注意不要炒糊焦。

sentences.english: The invention relates to a method for manufacturing a less-oil-smoke composite bottom iron pan.
sentences.chinese: 一种少油烟复底铁锅的制造方法。

sentences.english: IT BEGAN on August 4th with the metallic clink of a few pots and pans.
sentences.chinese: 始于8月4日，几只铁罐和铁锅叮叮当当地响。

sentences.english: An iron pot, suspended from a crane, bubbled over the flame.
sentences.chinese: 一只挂在吊钩上的铁锅在火焰中烧得发响。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, we fill another cauldron with water.
sentences.chinese: 同时，我们在另一个铁锅里注入水。

sentences.english: We take a big cauldron and fill it with cold water.
sentences.chinese: 我们把冷水注入这只大铁锅。

sentences.english: Decoct Chinese traditional medicine uses arenaceous boiler and need not what is the reason of iron bowl?
sentences.chinese: 煎中药应用砂锅而不用铁锅的原因是什么？

sentences.english: and pour the broth from the cauldron into a pan.
sentences.chinese: 将上汤从铁锅倒入平底锅中。

sentences.english: Put sand in an iron cauldron and fry it with maltose on a fire.
sentences.chinese: 先把沙子放入大铁锅中和麦芽糖一起翻炒。

sentences.english: Cook tomato sauce in iron pot for three hours, and its iron content increases strikingly.
sentences.chinese: 用铁锅熬番茄酱三个小时，起含铁量将大幅度增加。

sentences.english: Fill your wok with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to boil.
sentences.chinese: 铁锅装2到3英寸高的水，煮沸。

sentences.english: The sun-baked leaves were then taken to a furnace room and tossed into an enormous pan—what amounted to a very large iron wok.
sentences.chinese: 晒干后的茶叶被拿进炉子间，扔在一排大铁锅里。

sentences.english: One Saturday evening some girls boiled a chicken in a small pan.
sentences.chinese: 礼拜六的晚上，同学们用小铁锅煮着鸡子。

sentences.english: The cake is baked in an iron pan .

definition: see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
large kitchen stove made from bricks or earth/(PRC) ordinary mess hall (lowest dining standard, ranked below 中灶[zhong1 zao4] for mid-level cadres and 小灶[xiao3 zao4] for the most privileged)
to stir-fry/to do the cooking/stir-fried dish
variant of 砂鍋|砂锅[sha1 guo1]
